definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

sentences.english: As the rest of the prospectus shows, lining the founders' pockets is all Groupon cares about.
sentences.chinese: 招股說明顯示，梅森等人關心的只是自己的錢袋。

sentences.english: Prospectuses of stocks, selling documents of mutual funds, introductory articles of products.
sentences.chinese: 股票的招股書，基金的發售文件，產品介紹書等。

sentences.english: The bottom of the range is close to the company's net asset value.
sentences.chinese: 招股價下限和每股資產淨值相若。

sentences.english: The red-chip bubble ultimately burst， with most now trading at below their issue prices.
sentences.chinese: 紅籌泡沫最終爆破，大部分紅籌股都跌破招股價。

sentences.english: Prospectuses prepared by the Company shall comply with the relevant provisions of the CSRC.
sentences.chinese: 公司編制招股說明書應當符合中國證監會的相關規定。

sentences.english: Activities by an underwriter to support the offering price of a new issue stock in the aftermarket.
sentences.chinese: 承銷商在後市市場支持新股招股價的行動。

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: to ration merchandise (esp. food in times of shortages)
Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
sum of money raised (in a share subscription)
to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
